question.title: Package does not exist in the module-info declaration in Java
question.body:
My current Java project is designed using a multi-module structure, consisting of a backend and a frontend module. Each of these modules has its own pom.xml and module-info.java. The POM files are managed by a parent POM located at the project's root directory. While testing the connection between the frontend and backend, I encountered errors regarding missing package declarations:

... package com.library.backend.services does not exist
... package com.library.backend.dao does not exist

Solutions I've already implemented

  • Configured both modules on the module-path in IntelliJ IDEA.
  • Added the specific packages needed to the module-info.java of the frontend module.

Here are the relevant file contents

See Parent POM here

Backend

module-info.java

module com.library.backend {  
    requires java.sql;  
  
    exports com.library.backend;  
    exports com.library.backend.dao;  
    exports com.library.backend.services;  
}

See the pom.xml here

Frontend

module-info.java

module com.library.frontend {  
    requires com.library.backend;  
    requires javafx.fxml;  
    requires javafx.base;  
    requires javafx.graphics;  
    requires javafx.controls;  
    requires org.kordamp.ikonli.core;  
    requires org.kordamp.ikonli.javafx;  
    requires org.kordamp.ikonli.feather;  
  
    opens com.library.frontend to javafx.fxml;  
    opens com.library.frontend.controllers to javafx.fxml;  
  
    exports com.library.frontend;  
    exports com.library.frontend.controllers;  
}

See the pom.xml here

question_comments.body: Can you show how these packages would exist? Are there any classes in these packages? Where are these packages (which directories/module)?
Move the maven-compiler-plugin from <pluginManagement> to each child module's <build><plugins> OR inherit directly by moving it under <build><plugins> in the parent POM

Are you encountering those errors while trying a specific command? Could you elaborate on testing the connection between the modules? Would it be possible for you to share a reproducible example rather than the gists?
